CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 27, 1952, pg. 3, reads: "Celebrates 106th Birthday - Friends and neighbors, white and colored, of Mrs. Sabra Washington, gathered in her home last Saturday afternoon to celebrate her 106th birthday. Mrs. Washington, who was born in slavery, was a good-sized girl when the Civil War ended.  Her birthday party is made an annual event by her Brushton neighbors. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of former slave Sabre "Mother" Washington holding ornament and seated in chair with floral cover, on her 106th birthday, in her home on Conemaugh Street
